title: [BUG] `make test` fails on Ubuntu 18.04 (tests/unit/networking.tcl)
body:
**Describe the bug**

`make test` fails on Ubuntu 18.04 with error:

```
*** [err]: CONFIG SET bind address in tests/unit/networking.tcl
Expected 'OK' to match '*Failed to bind to specified addresses*' (context: type eval line 4 cmd {assert_match {*Failed to bind to specified addresses*} $e} proc ::start_server)
```

I tried to track down the issue and running just the failed test, but the output didn't help me either.

**To reproduce**

```
wget http://download.redis.io/redis-stable.tar.gz
tar xvzf redis-stable.tar.gz
cd redis-stable
make test

```

**Expected behavior**

`make test` does not fail

**Additional information**

Using Ubuntu 18.04. I have some servers where it works, but one server always fails. All servers are set up similarly.

<details>
